instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios issue
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage. After replacing everything boots and loads into OS now but wont install a new OS. Suspect bios issue. During installation the screen will go black and the fan will continue to spin but nothing else happens.  

Original dump [URL]https://drive.google.com/file/d/19oaDAsfhzMDM6zReDBltlsB88vEibi__/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios issue
threads.message: If this isnt a bios issue what should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios issue
threads.message:
What kind of macOS are you trying to install?

When you got into actual macOS, run a benchmark to see if machine is stable.
Check if HWMonitor reports some strange values.
Also start in diagnostic mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios issue
threads.message:
Mojave or Catalina. Both will not install. Ran benchmark for one hour via external OS seems stable.

All values on HW monitor look good.

Diagnostic mode found no issues.

When trying to shut down from external OS the machine never fully shuts down. Fan never stops spinning, even 30 minutes after shut down

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios issue
threads.message: Check if all S3 and S0 voltages turn off.
